definition: ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions
(of a livestock animal) plump and strong/well-fed
(of livestock) to fatten up/to put on weight
to feed livestock with highly nutritional food in order to fatten them up in a short time
to fatten cattle in a shed/to become fat

sentences.english: Giving pigs fine feed can fatten them up.
Fat on those of us who really care office is a good choice.
sentences.chinese: 關於我們這些辦公室養膘的人還真是個不錯的選擇。

sentences.english: During gestation, BW and backfat gain did not differ between treatment groups.
sentences.chinese: 整個妊娠期，兩組間體重和背膘厚均無顯著差異。

sentences.english: Trim any fat from pork fillets.
As he walked not a long distance with the cow, he saw a plump, soft-haired goat.
sentences.chinese: 他和牛沒走多遠，就看見一隻膘肥的細毛山羊。

sentences.english: Some people thought after winning it all last year you'd put on a few more pounds in the off-season .
sentences.chinese: 有些人覺得在去年大獲全勝之後你在休賽期又養膘了。

sentences.english: Then subluxate the talus and malleolus laterally to reach the joint surfaces.
sentences.chinese: 然後將距骨及內膘踝向外側半脫位，顯露關節面。
忘了保膘是一個還是五個。

definition: fat/fertile/loose-fitting or large/to fertilize/to become rich by illegal means/fertilizer/manure
(of a livestock animal) plump and strong/well-fed
fat (e.g. pork fat)/fatty meat/(fig.) a gold mine/cash cow
(fig.) attractive and easy mark/source of steady profit/moneymaker/cash cow
Minister of War (official title in pre-Han Chinese states)/two-character surname Sima
to shoot a glance/glance/to appear in a flash
